law.catch_line: Cabinet's monitoring of personnel standards for service providers - Personnel development.

text.section: The cabinet shall monitor personnel standards for service providers to ensure the qualified service providers necessary to carry out the provisions of KRS 200.650 to 200.676 are appropriately and adequately prepared and trained in order to comply with the requirements of federal law and regulations.

The cabinet shall provide the components of a comprehensive system of personnel development which shall include:
Preservice and inservice training conducted on an interdisciplinary basis to the extent appropriate; and
Training provided for a variety of entities, including but not limited to, public and private providers, primary referral sources, parents, paraprofessionals, and persons who serve as professional service coordinators or case managers.
The cabinet shall coordinate with other agencies in the provision of the comprehensive system of personnel development activities.

law.history: Created 1994 Ky. Acts ch. 313, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1994.
